page.title: 13Rawmarsh area: main features
page.content: {WENTWORTH PARK } The landscaped grounds of Wentworth Park contain one of England's finest stately homes,{Wentworth Woodhouse. The park contains many interesting features including many of the estate's 21 monuments. Among the best known of these are{Hoober Stand,}the {Needle's Eye}and the{Mausoleum.}This last commemorates the second Marquis of Rockingham, twice Prime Minister of Great Britain. Today mining subsidence prohibits public access to these monuments but their preservation is the concern of the{Wentworth Amenities {Trust}formed in 1979. There are also bridges, a bear-pit, estate lodges, sunken gardens, temples and a grotto. There is also a deershed - the park having a herd of seventy red deer.
